SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddEventFragment
This is the fragment which manages the UI and inputs for the creation of a new event
Event
This is a class that defines an event.
EventDetailsViewModel
Represents the event details activity displayed by clicking on events in the MyEvents menu
EventDetailsViewModel.EventDetailsCallback
Interface used for asynchronously accessing data for event details
EventDetailsViewModel.RegistrationWaitCallback
Interface used for asynchronously returning data for registration
EventFinderFragment
This is a fragment that provides a UI for scanning QR codes using the device camera.
EventFinderViewModel
This is the view model for the event finder fragment (sets the live data to be displayed)
EventQRCodeView
Represents the activity opened by clicking on "QR Code" in an event details page, which displays the QR code for that event.
EventsArrayAdapter
Adapter which manages the ListView displaying the events in the MyEvents activity
ExampleInstrumentedTest
Instrumented test, which will execute on an Android device.
ExampleUnitTest
Example local unit test, which will execute on the development machine (host).
Facility
Represents a facility storing basic information, including facility name, email, phone number, and owner ID.
FacilityInformationFragment
This class manages the fragment responsible for editing the facility information of an organizer
FacilityInformationViewModel
This is the class for the model which manages all the views for the user
GeolocationMap
An activity that displays a Google map with a marker (pin) to indicate a particular location.
GeolocationWarningFragment
Represents the warning fragment presented to users when trying to register for an event that uses geolocation
LotteryFragment
Represents the fragment shown to organizers who want to draw names for their event's lottery; requests number of entrants to draw
MainActivity
MainActivity initializes main features / setup for the app
ManageEntrantsFragment
Represents the activity displayed when organizers select "Manage Entrants" on the details screen for their event; manages entrants and can start lottery
ManageEntrantsFragment.DataCallback
Interface used for asynchronously accessing data for event details
MyEventsFragment
Represents the MyEvents page (homepage) of the app, used for managing events
MyEventsFragment.EventDataCallback
Interface used for asynchronously accessing data for event details
MyEventsFragment.RegistrationCallback
Interface used for asynchronously accessing data for registration
MyEventsFragment.RegistrationWaitCallback
Interface used for asynchronously returning data for registration
MyEventsViewModel
Represents the MyEvents activity (homepage); mostly default AndroidStudio implementation from sidebar
MyProfileFragment
Represents the MyProfile activity, used to change information about the user
MyProfileViewModel
Represents the ViewModel for the MyProfile activity, opened through the sidebar
NotificationHelper
This is a class that builds the notification channel and manages notification format.
Notifications
This is a class that sends notifications to selected and non selected users for an event.
QRCodeGenerator
This is the class responsible for generating a QR code string for a specified event
SelectedEntrantsFragment
Represents the Selected Entrants page of the app
SelectedEntrantsFragment.DataCallback
Interface used for asynchronously accessing data for event details
SettingsFragment
Represents the Settings activity, used to change settings for the user
SettingsViewModel
Represents the Settings activity; mostly default AndroidStudio implementation from sidebar
StartUpActivity
Represents the activity for a user to sign up for the app by providing basic personal information.
TestClass01
Instrumented tests for app classes
TestEvent
Tests Event class
TestUI01
Instrumented tests, testing the startUp activity and database integrations
TestUI02
Instrumented tests, testing the MainActivity, UI Navigation, and database integrations
TestUser
Tests User class
User
Represents a user storing basic personal information, including first name, last name, email, and optionally a phone number.
UserArrayAdapter
Adapter which manages the ListView displaying users in an event's "Manage Entrants" activity
